titles.title: To authorize the construction of a monument to honor those who have served the Nation's civil defense and emergency management programs.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.

bill.summary: 4/23/1998--Introduced. Authorizes the United States National Civil Defense Monument Commission to construct a monument to honor those who have served the nation's civil defense and emergency management programs. Terminates such authority seven years after the enactment of this Act, with an exception. Authorizes the Commission, subject to the approval of the Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), to select the monument site on FEMA lands in Emmitsburg, Maryland, and to develop the monument design. Requires monument costs to be paid from contributions to the Commission.
